posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked: Phoenix 6 25.4.0 is now available with CANdle support and new LED control features in Phoenix Tuner X. This release introduces parity between CANdle and Phoenix 6, along with initial support for LED control. Several CANdle-related features are under development for the upcoming 2026 season. The system provides a stable 5V 6A supply, enabling compatible coprocessors like Raspberry Pi or Orange Pi 5. A complete changelog is available online, and updates can be tracked via our RSS feed.

posts.name: Michael Hill
posts.cooked:
To install TunerX on your Windows computer due to the absence of an update in the Windows Store, follow these steps:

1. **Check Developer Documentation**: Visit the official TunerX website to download a PDF guide or look for any available resources explaining the installation process.

2. **Explore Community Forums**: Search platforms like Reddit or Microsoft's support site for user experiences or guides on installing TunerX outside the Windows Store.

3. **Extract ISO Directly**: Download the ISO file from a trusted source and run it directly without using an IsoChilean Installer, which may bypass any restrictions.

4. **Verify System Requirements**: Ensure your computer meets the listed system requirements for TunerX.

5. **Search Third-Party Sellers**: Look for third-party sellers offering an installer for TunerX, which might provide a workaround for the Windows Store issue.

6. **Contact Support**: If other methods fail, reach out to TunerX's support team for assistance or specific instructions regarding the latest version.

By systematically exploring these options, you should be able to successfully install TunerX on your Windows machine.

posts.name: Jared Russell
posts.cooked: If you keep this up, we're going to run out of things to complain about.

posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked: Don’t worry, we’ll have a “give us your feedback post” up soon enough where you can add more.

posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked: The Windows Store is slow to approve the update and should be available by the end of today.

posts.name: Michael Hill
posts.cooked: sweet thanks! I was able to get the phoenix 6 firmware working last night. Worked great!

posts.name: meer
posts.cooked:
damn y’all actually listened unlike half the other FRC companies /j
just my thoughts, but if the CANdle is brought up to Phoenix 6 then phoenix tuner should have some sort of GUI on controlling the CANdle. Being able to test multiple patterns and colors without redeploying and also having the ability to see what should happen vs whats actually happening is really useful.

on a serious note, thank you guys for this. we struggled with our CANdle multiple times this past year and in the end we had to just remove it so I’m hoping the bring up will allow us to debug a little easier so we can add back our LED feedback for the off-season.
